zone.line: misery only to be ended, and now about to
be ended, in death. But I forget myself, my
tale is yet untold. I will pause a few moments,
wipe my dim eyes, and to b endeavour to
lose the present obscure but heavy feeling
of unhappiness in the em more acute emo
I was born in England. My father was
a man of rank: he had lost his father
early, and was educated by a weak mother
with all the indulgence she thought due
to a nobleman of wealth. He was sent
to Eton and afterwards to colledge, & allowed
from childhood the free use of large sums of
money; thus enjoying from his earliest child
hood youth the independance which a boy with
these advantages, always acquires at a public school.
I will have a few moments; wipe my dim
